jorisvandenbossche commented on pull request #4534: ARROW-3686: [Python] support masked arrays in pa.array
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4534#discussion_r293036045
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/array.pxi
 ##########
 @@ -156,6 +156,14 @@ def array(object obj, type=None, mask=None, size=None, bint from_pandas=False,
 
         values = get_series_values(obj)
 
+        if np.ma.isMaskedArray(values):
+            if mask is not None:
+                raise ValueError("Cannot pass a numpy masked array and "
+                                 "specify a mask at the same time")
 
 Review comment:
   I could also give preference to either the passed mask or the mask of the data, but to avoid confusion about which of the two is used, I decided to error for now. But can also update to any of the other options.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on issue #4534: ARROW-3686: [Python] support masked arrays in pa.array
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4534#issuecomment-501423454
 
 
   Do you have a sense of what this does to microperformance of `pyarrow.array`? 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #4534: ARROW-3686: [Python] support masked arrays in pa.array
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4534#issuecomment-501583417
 
 
   A very quick check (on master, not this branch):
   
   ```
   In [45]: a = np.random.randn(10000) 
   
   In [46]: %timeit pa.array(a) 
   2.39 µs ± 35.4 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 100000 loops each)
   
   In [47]: %timeit np.ma.isMaskedArray(a) 
   172 ns ± 0.922 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 10000000 loops each)
   ```
   
   So for a very simple conversion (a float numpy array), the check would add around 5-10%. It seems that directly doing `isinstance(a, np.ma.MaskedArray)` is slightly faster (avoiding one extra function call, as that is exactly what the function above is doing).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on pull request #4534: ARROW-3686: [Python] support masked arrays in pa.array
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4534#discussion_r293413862
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/tests/test_array.py
 ##########
 @@ -1073,6 +1073,16 @@ def test_array_from_numpy_unicode():
     assert arrow_arr.equals(expected)
 
 
+def test_array_from_masked():
+    ma = np.ma.array([1, 2, 3, 4], mask=[False, False, True, False])
+    result = pa.array(ma)
+    expected = pa.array([1, 2, None, 4])
 
 Review comment:
   Careful. Are you sure Arrow selects the same default integer type? I don't think we should rely on that.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: Again, in this PR for vaex: [https://github.com/maartenbreddels/vaex/pull/116] I support masked arrays, it would be nice if this goes into pyarrow. If this approach looks good I could do a PR.
fields.summary: [Python] Support for masked arrays in to/from numpy

comments.body: We have a {{mask}} argument to {{pyarrow.array}} already. It would seem reasonable to detect {{ma.MaskedArray}} and grab its mask
Patches welcome. I'm moving this to 0.14 in the meantime
